root.name: Aztec Challenge
root.description: OverviewAztec Challenge was a Commodore 64 game by Paul Norman for Cosmi released in 1983. It was based on an Atari 2600 game of the same name by Robert Tegel Bonifacio. It is a game where the player takes on the role of a lone Aztec Warrior who must fight his way through a series of deadly challenges to become the next leader of the Aztecs.GameplayLevel 1 has you running a gauntlet of aztec warriors throwing spears at you while you run toward the Aztec TempleLevel 2 has you climbing the Aztec Temple stairs while avoiding falling boulders.Level 3 has you dodging falling arrows, rocks, pits in the floor and alligators popping up. Level 4 has you jumping over and dodging dangerous animals such as snakes, spiders and crocodiles. Level 5 is a booby trapped room when you have to jump from block to block. Level 6 has you swimming across a river filled with dangerous piranhas. Level 7 has you jumping over a shaky broken bridge with gaps.These levels cycle four times for the game to return to the title screen.RemakeThe game was remade as Aztec: Queen of Quezecotal and is available on Paul Norman's website DigitTARIUS
